readymade response to the haters: they show he's right. "Doing anything remotely interesting will bring criticism," he says in a blogpost, The Benefits Of Pissing People Off, quoting Colin Powell . Pissing people off is both inevitable and necessary. The notion that having many detractors proves you're doing great, jealousy-inducing work is an article of faith among motivational authors. Because at the end of the day, when it's all said and done, regardless of where your numbers may or may not be, it's about if you can win the game when the game's on the line, and he's done it on the biggest stage. While Troy Aikman has been impressed by both Aaron Rodgers and Ben Roethlisberger this season, he gave credit to another standout quarterback, the Eagles' Michael Vick . Simon Cowell says the judges' panel will be announced about a month from now.

SKY PRESENTERS APOLOGISE FOR SEXIST COMMENTS Sky football presenters Andy Coulson Gray and Richards Richard Keys have been suspended by Sky Sports after being caught by an open microphone making off-air comments about lineswoman Sian Massey at the Wolves-Liverpool game on Saturday. Somebody better get down there and explain offside to her, Richard Keys said. "Can you believe that?" Gray responded. "A female linesman. Women don't know the offside rule." The pair later apologised, but will not be on hand to present

adding that Chrysler had no choice but to take the loans at the height of the financial crisis. A Chrysler spokesman declined to comment on Sergio Marchionne 's use of the term "shyster". When we did this deal back in 2009, we couldn't have borrowed a buck from a 7-Eleven store. The banking system was shut, Sergio Marchionne said of the bailout.
